shortDescription: Reach and grasp shape, on back
longDescription: {0} is on their back. Place a shape near one of {0}'s hands. {0} is able to briefly grasp the shape for less than a second.

shortDescription: Reach and grasp shape, on side
longDescription: {0} is on their side. Place a shape near one of {0}'s hands. {0} is able to briefly grasp the shape for less than a second.

shortDescription: Reach and grasp shape, seated and supported
longDescription: {0} is seated and supported (e.g. you holding them up). Place a shape near one of {0}'s hands. {0} is able to grasp the shape for less than a second.

shortDescription: Hear cups and locate, on back
longDescription: {0} is on their back. Knock two cups together continuously away from {0}, so that they cannot see the cups, but can still hear them. {0} is able to search for and locate the source of the sounds by staring at the cups for one second.

shortDescription: Hear cups and locate, on side
longDescription: {0} is on their side. Knock two cups together continuously away from {0}, so that they cannot see the cups, but can still hear them. {0} is able to search for and locate the source of the sounds by staring at the cups for one second.

shortDescription: Hear cups and locate, seated and supported
longDescription: {0} is seated and supported (e.g. you holding them up). Knock two cups together continuously away from {0}, so that they cannot see the cups, but can still hear them. {0} is able to search for and locate the source of the sounds by staring at the cups for one second.

shortDescription: Hear cups and locate with head side turn, on tummy
longDescription: {0} is on their tummy. Knock two cups together continuously on one side of {0}'s head, so that they cannot see the cups, but can still hear them. {0} is able to search for and locate the source of the sounds by turning their head to the side and staring at the cups for one second.

shortDescription: Hear cups and locate with head up turn, on tummy
longDescription: {0} is on their tummy. Knock two cups together continuously above {0}'s head, so that they cannot see the cups, but can still hear them. {0} is able to search for and locate the source of the sounds by turning their head up slightly and staring at the cups for one second.

shortDescription: Eye track hiding cup, on back
longDescription: {0} is on their back. Move a cup slowly across {0}'s face until it is hidden behind your other hand. {0} is able to track the shape with their eyes, and stares at your hand after the shape is hidden for one second.

shortDescription: Eye track hiding cup, on side
longDescription: {0} is on their side. Move a cup slowly across {0}'s face until it is hidden behind your other hand. {0} is able to track the shape with their eyes, and stares at your hand after the shape is hidden for one second.

shortDescription: Eye track hiding cup, seated and supported
longDescription: {0} is seated and supported (e.g. you holding them up). Move a cup slowly across {0}'s face until it is hidden behind your other hand. {0} is able to track the shape with their eyes, and stares at your hand after the shape is hidden for one second.

shortDescription: Child squeals, when parent babbling sounds
longDescription: Make babbling sounds in front of their face. {0} is able to squeal (make high-pitched sounds) in reaction.

shortDescription: Bear some weight on legs, in a standing posture and supported.
longDescription: {0} is in a standing posture and supported (e.g. you holding them up). {0} is able to bear some weight on their legs.

shortDescription: Hold head up for 3 seconds, on tummy
longDescription: {0} is on their tummy. {0} is able to hold up their head at a slight angle for 3 seconds.

shortDescription: Hold head up for 1 minute, seated and supported
longDescription: {0} is seated and supported (e.g. you holding them up). {0} is able to hold up their head facing forwad for 1 minute.

shortDescription: Move head actively for 5 seconds, seated and supported
longDescription: {0} is seated and supported (e.g. you holding them up). {0} is able to move their head actively for 5 seconds.

shortDescription: Hold body upright, seated and somewhat supported
longDescription: {0} is seated and somewhat supported (e.g. {0} leaning on you). {0} is able to hold their trunk (body) fairly upright.
{0} is able to roll from their tummy to their back.
{0} is able to roll from their tummy to their side.
